meanings.def: a liquid that is put on surfaces to give them a particular colour; a layer of this liquid when it has dried on a surface
examples: white paint
gloss/matt/acrylic paint
The woodwork has recently been given a fresh coat of paint.
Wet paint! (= used as a sign)
The paint is starting to peel off.
The house is desperately in need of a lick of paint (= a new coat of paint).
We did a quick paint job on the car (= a new coat of paint to make it look better) and hoped the damage wasn't noticeable.
a can/pot/tin of paint
The aircraft have been repainted in the original red and black paint scheme.
The artist has used several layers of paint to create the stormy sky.
The stove is available in two metallic paint finishes.

meanings.def: tubes or blocks of paint used for painting pictures
examples: oil paints
an artist working with acrylic paints

meanings.def: to cover a surface or object with paint
examples: paint something with something Paint the shed with weather-resistant paint.
paint something a brightly painted barge
a freshly painted fence
have something painted We've had the house painted.
paint something + adj. The walls were painted yellow.
Paint the box all over with varnish.
The walls had been painted very badly.

meanings.def: to make a picture or design using paints
examples: paint something/somebody to paint portraits/pictures
A friend painted the children for me (= painted a picture of the children).
paint something on something Slogans had been painted on the walls.
paint in something She paints in oils.
paint something in something a portrait painted in oils
My mother paints well.
He taught himself to draw and paint.
a crudely painted human figure
I like to paint on canvas.

meanings.def: to give a particular impression of somebody/something
examples: paint somebody/something as something The article paints them as a bunch of petty criminals.
paint somebody/something in… The documentary painted her in a bad light.

meanings.def: to put coloured make-up on your nails, lips, etc.
not as bad as people say he/she/it is
examples: He's not very friendly, but he's not as black as he's painted.

meanings.def: to describe somebody/something in a particular way; to give a particular impression of somebody/something
examples: The report paints a vivid picture of life in the city.
Journalists paint a grim picture of conditions in the camps.
He didn't paint a very pretty picture of city life.
The report paints a dismal picture of the government's economic record.

meanings.def: to go to a lot of different bars, clubs, etc. and enjoy yourself
to describe something in a general way, ignoring the details

idioms.idiom: not as black as he/she/it is painted
idioms.def: not as bad as people say he/she/it is
examples: He's not very friendly, but he's not as black as he's painted.

idioms.idiom: paint a (grim, gloomy, rosy, etc.) picture of somebody/something
idioms.def: to describe somebody/something in a particular way; to give a particular impression of somebody/something
examples: The report paints a vivid picture of life in the city.
Journalists paint a grim picture of conditions in the camps.
He didn't paint a very pretty picture of city life.
The report paints a dismal picture of the government's economic record.

idioms.def: to go to a lot of different bars, clubs, etc. and enjoy yourself

idioms.idiom: paint something with a broad brush
idioms.def: to describe something in a general way, ignoring the details
